content.description:
Number 6 on the photo. An endurance alternative to the wall. Starts up

Lavazza

. Climb to the 3rd bolt and then beat out left on slopers to a hard clip at the 4th bolt. Continue whacking up and left to a roof. Rest below it, and then whip up and over into the face above. Continue crushing  through the crimps, slopers, and sidepulls to the chains.
content.location: Middle of the wall. Belays below the small mine by a bush.

content.description: Fantastic crimping and jugs up a steep wall on the left side of the Threshold. Well worth the hike.
content.location: Far left climb on the wall

content.description: A steamy brew of slopers and edges with longer moves. Cruise up the slab to the first bolt and chill out before the second, then, savor the flavor of the robust moves into the steep overhang. Don't get too jittery, this hot pot isn't over yet. Pull through and gain the blocky face to the anchors. To some, it's a route that's bitter to the tongue, to others it's a rich and satisfying cup of Joe.
content.location:
To the left of

Funk

. Pulls the steep overhang with a tan streak.

#7 in the Threshold photo.

content.description: It looks pretty darn easy. Just a simple layback problem...but lo'...and how! While the holds seem really big, they all seem the lean just enough to make them less than perfect jugs. Be ready for the pump to kick in and then fight it on your way to the chains.
content.location: Climbs the big overhanging right facing corner in the center of the wall.

content.description: Climb through broken rock to the second bolt and then traverse right a bit to the third bolt. Get up on the steeply-sloped yellowish section, weave a bit as you figure out where the holds are through the next two bolts. The angle then eases off a bit on the run to the chains.
content.location:
Third line from the right; shares the first bolt with

Funk

to the left.

content.description: Groove on up a slightly slabby start to the first bolt. At the second, stay left into a slight corner and, when you feel lonely of holds, set up, look up, and get down to the jump of the funky funk to the nasty jugs brotha. Mellow out before heading up a slightly steep section and then boogy on up the slab to anchors. FEEL THE FUNK YO!
content.protection: 8 Draws of Quickness should treat you right. Ahhhh Yeah.
content.location: Just ask yourself, "Where would Curtis Climb?"

content.description:
Nice, short climb on good limestone. This route is the right-most route on

Threshold

as you face

Threshold

from the west.

The walk up the canyon is pleasant and the location is beautiful. In the spring you can see and hear the creek running by.

The route has a little of everything: crimpers, slopers, smearing, sidepulls (no pockets, though).

There are a couple of areas of wiggly rock, but they should clean up, and most of the route is solid.
Pull a roof right off the ground, then easier climbing to a thin section.
content.location:
Second route from the right on the

Threshold

, before the wall starts to get really steep.
